meanings.definition: A person who pretends to have a particular feeling or attitude.
meanings.sent1: The affecters in the play were skilled at pretending to be sad.
meanings.sent2: She could tell he was an affecter, not truly happy but pretending.
meanings.sent3: The affecters at the party made everyone believe they were having a great time.
meanings.sent4: The affecters in the movie were like chameleons, changing emotions effortlessly.
meanings.sent5: The affecters in the theater troupe were praised for their convincing performances.

meanings.definition: A person who influences or causes a change in something.
meanings.sent1: The affecters of the decision were the key players in the company.
meanings.sent2: As an affecter of trends, she had a significant impact on fashion.
meanings.sent3: The affecters of the experiment were the scientists who designed it.
meanings.sent4: His words were the affecters of her change in perspective.
meanings.sent5: The affecters of the market were the big corporations with their strategies.

meanings.definition: To make a difference to; to produce a change in.
meanings.sent1: Her positive attitude can affecters the mood of the whole room.
meanings.sent2: The new policy will affecters how we operate our business.
meanings.sent3: He tried to affecters the outcome by working harder.
meanings.sent4: The storm will affecters the schedule of the outdoor event.
meanings.sent5: The teacher's feedback can affecters the student's performance significantly.
